channel.title: WSJ.com: World News

item.title: Poland Says Rail Explosion Was ‘Act of Sabotage’
item.description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the goal of the sabotage was to blow up a train and that additional damage had been identified elsewhere on the route.
item.dc:creator: Karolina Jeznach

item.title: Saab Shares Soar on Colombia Fighter Jet Deal
item.description: Shares gained 7.9% following confirmation of the order. Colombia will become the fourth country to operate the newest variant of the Gripen.
item.dc:creator: Dominic Chopping

item.title: EU Lowers Growth Outlook for 2026 on Higher-Than-Forecast U.S. Tariffs
item.description: The bloc raised its growth expectations for the eurozone this year, though tariffs are expected to weigh on the outlook for 2026.
item.dc:creator: Don Nico Forbes

item.title: Tokyo to Improve Content Creators’ Work Conditions Under ‘Cool Japan’ Strategy
item.description: Japan’s minister in charge of promoting its cultural exports pledged to improve working conditions for content creators as part of a renewed government push to expand the global reach of the entertainment industry.
item.dc:creator: Megumi Fujikawa

item.title: Former Bangladeshi Leader Sheikh Hasina Sentenced to Death Over Protest Crackdown
item.description: The former prime minister was convicted for her role in the killing of at least 1,400 protesters last year.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Hamas’s Popularity Rises in Gaza, Complicating Trump Plan to Disarm Militants
item.description: Many Palestinians in Gaza want the militant group to leave power, but still welcome a crackdown on crime that followed last month’s cease-fire.
item.dc:creator: Suha Ma’ayeh

item.title: Chile Vote Positions Country for Trump-Era Right Turn
item.description: Chileans rallied behind hard-line conservatives in elections Sunday as anger over crime and immigration pushes the country to the right—setting the stage for a possible alignment with Trump.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Pearson

item.title: New Nuclear Arms Race Pits U.S. Against Both Russia and China
item.description: After a decadeslong hiatus, the weapons have surged back to the forefront of global politics.
item.dc:creator: Yaroslav Trofimov

item.title: Trump Says U.S. May Hold Talks With Venezuela’s Maduro
item.description: A U.S. military buildup has been unfolding near the South American country, and Maduro has accused Washington of trying to topple him.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Opinion | Hatred of Israel Caused Iran’s Water Crisis
item.description: Engineers from the Jewish state built an efficient infrastructure. Then came the 1979 revolution.
item.dc:creator: Seth M. Siegel

item.title: Opinion | Venezuela Aims to Gobble Up Honduras
item.description: Caracas coaches the leftist party on how to steal the Nov. 30 presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Mary Anastasia O’Grady

item.title: New Rare-Earths Plant in Europe Shows How Tough Breaking China’s Grip Will Be
item.description: The Estonian factory marks a big boost to the continent’s production but is only a start to satisfying soaring demand.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: U.S. Boat Strikes Are Straining the Counterdrug Alliance
item.description: The U.S. military relies on international partners to counter the narcotics trade, but allies won’t back the lethal attacks.
item.dc:creator: Shelby Holliday

item.title: Iran Seizes Fuel Tanker in Middle East Waterway
item.description: The seizure of the vessel, which Iran’s navy said was carrying unauthorized goods, comes amid unresolved nuclear issues between Tehran and the West.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: Ukraine’s $200 Billion Lifeline From Europe Stumbles on Pushback in Belgium
item.description: The Belgian government fears financial fallout and Russian retaliation from EU plan to fund Kyiv using Moscow’s money held in Belgium.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Opinion | British Labour’s Fiscal Mess
item.description: Lack of an economic-growth plan saps the fisc and spooks investors.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Secret U.S. Memo Authorizing Drug-Boat Strikes Cites Chemical Weapon Threat
item.description: The brief outlines the Trump administration’s legal case for military action against alleged drug-carrying boats in the Caribbean and Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: China Tells Citizens to Avoid Japan as Taiwan Spat Deepens
item.description: Beijing is furious with the Japanese prime minister after she said Japan would defend itself if China moved to seize the island.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: The Gold Bar Diplomacy That Won Switzerland a Trade Deal With Trump
item.description: ​The deal came together after months of shuttle diplomacy and a charm offensive by the Alpine nation’s secret weapon: its billionaires.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Opinion | What Does ‘White Guilt’ Mean in 2025?
item.description: Victim politics gave us pro-Hamas activism and a powerful reaction in the form of Donald Trump, argue Shelby Steele and his son, Eli.
item.dc:creator: Tunku Varadarajan

item.title: Opinion | Maduro Caused the Disaster
item.description: He and Chávez created the crisis in Venezuela, not Trump.

item.title: Israeli Settlers Burn Mosque as West Bank Violence Escalates
item.description: Israeli settlers extended a wave of attacks in the West Bank, drawing rare condemnation from authorities and concern from the U.S. over the escalating violence.
item.dc:creator: Feliz Solomon

item.title: Enbridge $1.4 Billion Project Aims to Boost Canadian Oil Flow to U.S. Refineries
item.description: Pipeline operator Enbridge will push ahead with a $1.4 billion expansion of its core network to boost deliveries of Canadian heavy oil and reach key refining markets in the U.S. Midwest and Gulf Coast.
item.dc:creator: Robb M. Stewart

item.title: How American and Chinese Drone Arsenals Stack Up
item.description: A head-to-head comparison of unmanned aircraft shows the global rivals in a close race.
item.dc:creator: Liza Lin

item.title: U.K. Assets Fall on Prospect of U-Turn on Government’s Income Tax Hike Plans
item.description: Sterling, U.K. government bonds and equities sold off on fresh concerns about fiscal sustainability ahead of the Nov. 26 budget.
item.dc:creator: Renae Dyer

item.title: China Registers Worst Investment Decline in Years as Slowdown Continues
item.description: Consumption also slowed, with retail sales on their longest run of decelerating growth since 2021.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: U.S. to Cut Tariffs on Bananas, Coffee and Other Goods From Four Countries
item.description: The move would ease some signature Trump-administration duties on items from Ecuador, Argentina, El Salvador and Guatemala.
item.dc:creator: Gavin Bade

item.title: Putin Is Turning Eighth-Grade Classrooms Into Army Training Grounds
item.description: A vast militarization of the education system is gathering pace in Russian classrooms, where students are trained to handle weapons by active soldiers.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: Opinion | AI Is a Tool, Not a Soul
item.description: Pope Leo XIV tries to head off claims that chatbots are sentient beings with rights.
item.dc:creator: Joshua Treviño

item.title: Germany’s Answer to Its Conscription Dilemma: a Database of Young Men Fit for War
item.description: European countries are grappling with how to repopulate their armed forces under pressure from Washington and an expansionist Russia.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Iraq Election Results Set Stage for a Long Power Struggle
item.description: The prime minister’s coalition came first, but Iran-backed militias also had a strong showing, likely setting up months of talks to select the next leader.
item.dc:creator: Saleh al-Batati

item.title: Britain Is Preparing Tens of Billions in New Taxes—Again
item.description: The Labour government is readying its second major tax increase in two years as it tries to avoid spooking markets.
item.dc:creator: David Luhnow

item.title: France Is Awash in Museum Heists
item.description: It’s not just the Louvre. Minimal security and the high price of gold have fueled nine heists over the past year.
item.dc:creator: Bertrand Benoit

item.title: Two Senior Ukrainian Ministers Resign Amid Widening Corruption Probe
item.description: The investigation has put Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in a political bind, with Russia advancing and members of his inner circle accused of embezzlement.
item.dc:creator: Ian Lovett

item.title: Trump Asks Israel’s President to Pardon Netanyahu From Corruption Charges
item.description: The U.S. president called the allegations against the Israeli prime minister “a political, unjustified prosecution.”
item.dc:creator: Dov Lieber

item.title: The Gaza War Has Been Big Business for U.S. Companies
item.description: The conflict has generated billions of dollars in sales for American firms.
item.dc:creator: Benoit Faucon

item.title: What the Looming Fall of a Ukrainian City Says About Putin’s War
item.description: The brutal fight for Pokrovsk points to the Russian leader’s aims and the problem with peace talks.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: America’s Chip Restrictions Are Biting in China
item.description: Shortages of advanced AI chips are so acute that Beijing is intervening, and tech companies are resorting to workarounds.
item.dc:creator: Robbie Whelan

item.title: Arrival of U.S.’s Largest Warship Ratchets Up Pressure on Venezuela
item.description: The USS Gerald R. Ford carrier strike group is in waters off Latin America, as the buildup of U.S. forces continues in the Caribbean.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: Leaked-Video Scandal Tests Israel’s Ability to Investigate Its Own Soldiers
item.description: The military’s former top lawyer is now under scrutiny, complicating a case alleging abuse of a Palestinian prisoner.
item.dc:creator: Anat Peled

item.title: Pakistan Points Finger at India Over Suicide Blast
item.description: The accusation came as India’s prime minister vowed to find the perpetrators of a separate deadly explosion on Monday.
item.dc:creator: Krishna Pokharel

item.title: Milei Wants to Turn Argentina Into a Mining Powerhouse
item.description: The Argentine president is tearing down barriers for digging up his country’s vast reserves of copper.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Dubé

item.title: Father and Daughter Missionaries Killed in Plane Crash Bringing Aid to Jamaica
item.description: A Christian minister and his daughter died when their small plane crashed in a suburban neighborhood outside Fort Lauderdale, Fla.
item.dc:creator: Jack Morphet

item.title: China Hatches Plan to Keep U.S. Military From Getting Its Rare-Earth Magnets
item.description: Beijing is considering a “validated end-user” system that would facilitate the export of such materials.
item.dc:creator: Raffaele Huang

item.title: Car Explosion in India’s Capital Kills Eight
item.description: Indian officials said it was too early to say if the blast was the result of a bomb.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: The Lavish Lifestyle of an Alleged Chinese Agent Gets a Spotlight in Trial
item.description: Charges say New York state aide bought a mansion, a condo and a Ferrari thanks to favors from the Chinese government in exchange for influencing policy toward Beijing.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Bank of England Announces Proposals on Stablecoin Regulation
item.description: Under the BOE’s regime, individuals would be limited to owning up to 20,000 pounds of sterling-denominated systemic stablecoins, while businesses would be limited to holding up to 10 million pounds.

item.title: The Power of Gen Z Protesters Meets Lethal Force in Tanzania
item.description: Demonstrators have been protesting the cost of living and President Samia Suluhu Hassan’s tightening grip on power.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: A Truth Social Threat and a Scramble in Nigeria to Avert Military Action
item.description: The West African country is trying to persuade Trump not to insert the U.S. military or cut off aid as largely Muslim cattle herdsmen are accused of killing Christians.
item.dc:creator: Joe Parkinson

item.title: China’s Deflationary Pressures Eased in October
item.description: China’s downward price pressures further eased in October, in part thanks to the boost from a week-long holiday as well as Beijing’s ongoing efforts to curb excess capacity in some key sectors.

item.title: Britain’s Disgraced Ex-Prince Andrew Didn’t Lose All His Titles
item.description: A constitutional headache for Buckingham Palace means that he is still de facto the Duke of York.
item.dc:creator: Max Colchester

item.title: Trump Administration Blocks Gunvor Takeover of Russian Oil Assets
item.description: The Swiss commodities trader pulled its offer after the Treasury Department said it opposed the deal.
item.dc:creator: Georgi Kantchev

item.title: Putin Paves Way to Resume Nuclear Testing as Tensions Flare With Trump
item.description: The Russian leader said Moscow could return to nuclear testing if the U.S. begins testing its own arsenal.
item.dc:creator: Thomas Grove

item.title: Russia’s New War Grifters—‘Black Widows’ Duping Soldiers Into Marriage
item.description: Authorities say women are marrying servicemen in an attempt to get the death payouts that go to their families.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Luxmoore

item.title: U.K. Treasury Chief Says Lowering Inflation Will Be Budget Focus
item.description: Reeves declined to rule out a rise in taxes, which many see as the only option left to the government if it is to achieve its goals.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hannon

item.title: Why a Song for Sad English Soccer Fans Is at the Center of a Fight Gripping Africa
item.description: Supporters of a deceased Zambian president have appropriated “Three Lions” in their campaign to bring his body home.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Trump Threatens Military Action in Nigeria in Defense of Christians
item.description: The president said the U.S. could go in “guns-a-blazing” to halt the perceived targeting of Christians by Islamist militants.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Wexler

item.title: Sudan Militia, Armed With Drones, Hunts Down Black Population of Darfur
item.description: The country’s civil war has triggered a wave of brutal reprisals targeting the region’s Black population.
item.dc:creator: Nicholas Bariyo

item.title: Will India and China Be Able to Resist U.S. Sanctions on Russian Oil?
item.description: New Delhi and Beijing have so far resisted U.S. calls to stop buying Russian crude, but far-reaching sanctions will be hard to ignore.
item.dc:creator: Jiahui Huang

item.title: Trump Signals Support for Selling Submarines to Australia
item.description: The president’s comments calmed fears that he would pull out of the Biden-era deal and came as he struck an agreement with the U.S. ally on rare earths.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: How a Right-Wing Hindu Group Went From Fringe to Mainstream in India
item.description: India’s Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh group is stepping out of the shadows and flexing its power.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Trump Organization Expands in India, Where Many of Its Partners Face Accusations
item.description: Indian real-estate firms have been accused of fraud, money laundering and more on other projects. The Trumps have stepped up overseas deals in the president’s second term.
item.dc:creator: Peter Grant

item.title: India Delicately Counters Trump Claim It Will Drop Russian Oil
item.description: New Delhi didn’t outright contradict the president, saying it was committed to protecting consumers by diversifying its energy supplies.
item.dc:creator: Shan Li

item.title: Pentagon Review of Aukus Security Pact Worries U.K., Australia
item.description: The review throws into doubt a strategic partnership that aims to give Australia nuclear-powered submarines and deter Chinese aggression in the Indo-Pacific.
item.dc:creator: Rhiannon Hoyle

item.title: The Best Travel Shoes to Make Every Trip Lighter and Easier
item.description: No matter the destination, these shoes will get you there.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Selinger

item.title: The Best Laptop Backpacks, According to CEOs, Pilots and Stylists
item.description: From commuting to long-haul flights, these are the bags avid travelers rely on for their trips.
item.dc:creator: Sal Vaglica

item.title: Best of Buy Side Awards 2025: Travel
item.description: Tried and tested by our expert travel writers and editors, these Buy Side best product award-winning luggage picks will ensure your trip gets off to a great start.
item.dc:creator: Nick Guy

item.title: Russia’s Side Quest to Dominate Africa: Hijack a Videogame
item.description: Players in the ‘African Dawn’ videogame are asked to choose a side aligned with either Russia or the West.
item.dc:creator: Sarah E. Needleman

item.title: Families Battle Tech Giants as Australia Pushes for an Under-16 Social-Media Ban
item.description: The proposal marks the latest effort by political leaders worldwide to regulate children’s use of platforms, amid concerns that it is harming their mental health.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: ‘We’ve Got to Kill’: Inside New Zealand’s Mission to Wipe Out Predators
item.description: Scientists debate whether a multibillion-dollar plan to eliminate invasive animals by 2050 is feasible.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney
